intro: Castanopsis hainanensis, commonly known as Hainan stone栎, is a species of evergreen tree native to the tropical rainforests of Hainan Island in China. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks, beeches, and chestnuts, and is characterized by its hard, durable wood. The plant produces small, cup-shaped fruits that contain one or two seeds, typical of the genus Castanopsis. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions with high humidity. Due to its ecological importance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in its native habitat.
